statements: SELECT * FROM customer_orders ORDER BY order_id DESC;
SELECT customer_id, product_id FROM customer_orders WHERE customer_id = 100;
SELECT order_id, customer_id, product_id FROM customer_orders WHERE order_id > 500 AND product_id = 200;
SELECT * FROM customer_orders WHERE product_id IN (100, 200, 300);
SELECT order_id, customer_id, product_id FROM customer_orders WHERE order_id BETWEEN 300 AND 400;
SELECT * FROM customer_orders WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT order_id, customer_id, product_id FROM customer_orders WHERE customer_id = 3 ORDER BY order_id DESC;
SELECT order_id, product_id FROM customer_orders WHERE order_id < 100 AND customer_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM customer_orders WHERE product_id IN (SELECT product_id FROM products WHERE price > 50);
SELECT MAX(order_id) AS max_order_id FROM customer_orders;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_id FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name FROM products WHERE product_id = 5;
SELECT customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id IN (1, 2, 3);
SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY product_id, customer_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY customer_id DESC;
SELECT customer_name, product_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.product_id = products.product_id;
SELECT customer_name, product_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.product_id = products.product_id WHERE orders.product_id = 2;

SELECT customer_name, COUNT(product_name) AS num_products FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.product_id = products.product_id GROUP BY customer_name;
SELECT MAX(product_id), AVG(product_id) FROM products;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_id FROM customers;
SELECT order_id, customer_id, product_id, order_date FROM orders;
SELECT product_name, product_id FROM products WHERE product_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date = '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_id FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 10;

SELECT customers.customer_name, products.product_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.product_id = products.product_id ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, COUNT(*) AS total_orders FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id GROUP BY customer_name HAVING COUNT(*) > 3;

SELECT customer_name, product_name FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN products ON orders.product_id = products.product_id WHERE customer_name LIKE 'J%' ORDER BY customer_name ASC, product_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT product_name, product_price FROM products ORDER BY product_price DESC;

SELECT customer_name, product_name, quantity FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id JOIN order_details ON orders.order_id = order_details.order_id JOIN products ON order_details.product_id = products.product_id;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, order_date FROM orders INNER JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE order_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT product_name, SUM(quantity) AS total_quantity FROM order_details INNER JOIN products ON order_details.product_id = products.product_id GROUP BY product_name HAVING total_quantity > 10;
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30' ORDER BY order_date ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT product_name, product_id FROM products ORDER BY product_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_date > '2022-01-01';

SELECT customer_name, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM customers INNER JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id INNER JOIN payment ON orders.order_id = payment.order_id GROUP BY customer_name ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 5;
SELECT product_name, quantity FROM products p JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id = oi.product_id;
SELECT o.order_id, o.order_date, c.customer_name FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id;
SELECT order_id, SUM(amount) AS total_amount FROM payment GROUP BY order_id HAVING SUM(amount) > 1000;
